title: [Medicine] Japanese researchers discovered that a chemical called sesaminol, abundant in sesame seed shells normally thrown out as waste, has protective effects against Parkinson's disease. Feeding mice a diet containing sesaminol for 36 days saw an increase in dopamine levels and motor performance.
[Neuroscience] AI can now read brain data and generate personally attractive images. Researchers have succeeded in making an AI understand our subjective notions of what makes faces attractive.
